intro: Corallodendron crista-galli, commonly known as the "Crown of Thorns," is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Didiereaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, thorn-covered stems and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are edible for humans but toxic to livestock. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to low rainfall and high temperatures through its succulent stems and reduced leaves. Corallodendron crista-galli is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has cultural significance in some regions.
